reviewText:
This game is terrible.

For starters, there is no tutorial. The game thrusts you right in with the options of Mens Prison, Womens Prison or Military Prison. It does not explain what the differences are between them (if there are any at all) or what each prison will actually involve, you're just expected to guess.
I went with the first option. Mens Prison.
Once in the game there is no guide on what to do, no objectives, nothing helpful at all. It doesn't even clearly show you which plot of land you should be building on which is annoying as first impressions.
Once you start to figure things out on your own, such as how the menus work, what you should be building and such, you expect the game to get better but it doesn't.
It's drab attempts at being a 'prison tycoon' just makes you frustrated and bored. The learning curve is huge and i'm sure there's many things i'm missing because the game just doesn't explain to you what to do or how to do it (apart from the 'manual' which i've given a read and it isn't very helpful).

The graphics are average for the release date but when the gameplay is boring the drab graphics don't do anything to help ignite your enthusiasm and the same goes with the menus and other interface options. They are downright ugly, and 90% of the times the options are not labelled and do not explain to you what they do, there is just a random picture which you yourself must decipher.

I'm sure if I put another 10 hours into the game I may learn how to play it fully, but I doubt that even if I did learn the more complicated parts of it I would still not find the game enjoyable.
There are many better tycoon games out there for your money, I just can't recommend this at all.

reviewText: This game is mind knumbingly boring and very buggy. The AI is extremely poor and controlling your guards requires a huge amount of micro management. You can't give movement orders while the game is paused, and this becomes a problem when an inmate is sprinting at mach 4 over your fance and is gone before you can click on him. Putting a guard in a tower is pointless because they get confused and walk forever and stand by while inmates sprint by them and hop the fence. The AI for the inmates is also terrible. I had a few stave to death because they forgot to eat and just paced around in circles all day. On top of that the game is prone to crashes. Stay away from this one!

reviewText:
First off, this is a pretty old game. It was released in 2007, so don't expect 2014 graphics. You start with an area of land and an amount of cash to start your prison. You first need to put some fencing up, plop a place for the inmates to sleep and a security building. From there you just continue to expand until all available buildings have been placed and you have your prison. It took me a few prisons to get the hang of what you need to do so inmates aren't constatntly jumping the fence and making a runner for it. On my fourth or fifth prison I finally got the hang of security and that was when I was able to excell to Max Security.

Given how old this game is, I'm surprised I didn't have to use compatibility mode. If you have some problems with starting the game try using xp sp2 compatibility mode. It has a fair few bugs that can be worked around, fencing is easy to make a mess of which leads to crashes etc. Guard patrols for the most part work fine, but can crash if you try to issue too many commands to the same guard too quickly. In essence, if you can master the guards and security you can get some pretty pumping prisons going.

The game has a long learning curve, even with the manual having a bit of detail in it. It wasn't until close to 7 hours of gameplay that I had that ahhh
date: so that's what you have to do" moment

reviewText: Oh man prepare yourself for the best game ever made by anyone!  When the game starts you have not one not two but yes three types of prison's you can run as none other then the warden yourself with your high preformance stick and small flag mouse on the screen. I know what your thinking how can only one man run a whole prison by himself? But with Prison Tycoon 3 its possible. If you have all the time in the world to just ♥♥♥♥ around with this game that will get you no ware in a hurry by all means this is for you! Like I said you can pick three types of prison's you can run men's, women's, or military. Trust me you want to run the military prison its so cool! Tanks in the back ground whats not to like! You start with $10000.00 so the sky is the limit!. The music top notch in my book. Nothing beats the sound of the old west like your a true outlaw the whole time you play! And it gets better! By the time you have build the whole fence around your prison you don't have a damn dime left to your name! Now how do you make money well here's the BEST part of the WHOLE game YOU CANT MAKE MONEY!!! Yes people you can not make one cent in Prison Tycoon 3. You can even save your game so you can come back to that boring ♥♥♥♥ing game that you left one year ago just to find that you still don't have any money and you have to destroy building and fences to pay your guards. Oh yeah and let me tell you that same old wild west music 5 out of 5 in my book thanks guys for making one of the best Tycoons out there! 10 out of 5!

reviewText:
If you imagine that this game will bring you pleasure...you are mistaken.

I owned and played this game often when I was younger and was stuck at my grandmother's house for days. When I purchased this game, it was from pure nostalgia. I remembered when I would play this game for hours on end, and I recalled how much enjoyment I got from it...

...After I bought this game, I remembered that the only reason I played this game was because the choices at my grandmothers place was 1) play this game 2) go to Church or 3) watch re-runs of the Andy Griffith show, and there is only so much of Deputy Don i can take before I'm willing to do almost anything...and I'm not a Christian, so I chose Prison Tycoon.

Don't waste your money. The only reason this game should be bought is as a prank gift to a good buddy when you have a few extra bucks to spend.

The graphics are sub-par (even when it was first released), UI is almost worthless, no tutorial (let me say that im not a huge advocate for tutorials...i don't usually need EVERY small detail explaned over the course of a half hour. But this game REALLY needs it), and worse of all...your prisioners WILL escape. Put up a tall af fence with rolls of barb-wire? They climb over it like a jungle gym. Got 100+ guards on duty & 20 Guard Towers to help catch them? Still climb fence, and still escape. Nothing you do will prevent this, and no matter what they WILL get away.

Not to mention the economy. Seems simple...build a factory or two, fill it with shops, assign prisoners to work schedules, and make money...right? WRONG! Why? Because even though you have the proper facilities and mechanisms in place to get them to work...they just dont feel like working. So, you will go broke pretty quick as you watch your lazy idiot guards pimp walk around while your prisoners are running off into the sunset.

TL;DR - Game sucks. Move along.
